headline.main: How Exercise Can Strengthen the Brain

docs.abstract: For the first time scientists showed that, in mice at least, exercise spurs the development of mitochondria in brain cells and may make the brain more fit, similar to the way exercise makes muscles stronger.
docs.snippet: For the first time scientists showed that, in mice at least, exercise spurs the development of mitochondria in brain cells and may make the brain more fit, similar to the way exercise makes muscles stronger.

headline.main: How Exercise Can Strengthen the Brain

docs.abstract: For the first time scientists showed that, in mice at least, exercise spurs the development of mitochondria in brain cells and may make the brain more fit, similar to the way exercise makes muscles stronger.
docs.lead_paragraph: Can exercise make the brain more fit? That absorbing question inspired a new study at the University of South Carolina during which scientists assembled mice and assigned half to run for an hour a day on little treadmills, while the rest lounged in their cages without exercising.
docs.snippet: For the first time scientists showed that, in mice at least, exercise spurs the development of mitochondria in brain cells and may make the brain more fit, similar to the way exercise makes muscles stronger.

headline.main: Experts Urge Testing of Ban on Use of Food Stamps for Soda

docs.abstract: An essay in a leading medical journal chastises the federal government for not allowing New York City to ban the use of food stamps to buy sugary drinks.
docs.snippet: An essay in a leading medical journal chastises the federal government for not allowing New York City to ban the use of food stamps to buy sugary drinks.

headline.main: Experts Urge Testing of Ban on Use of Food Stamps for Soda

docs.abstract: An essay in a leading medical journal chastises the federal government for not allowing New York City to ban the use of food stamps to buy sugary drinks.
docs.lead_paragraph: In an influential medical journal, two prominent experts on nutrition are assailing the federal government's rejection of New York City's proposal to ban the purchase of sodas with food stamps.
docs.snippet: An essay in a leading medical journal chastises the federal government for not allowing New York City to ban the use of food stamps to buy sugary drinks.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

headline.seo: Small Fixes: The Simplest Health Solutions? It’s Complicated
headline.print_headline: The Simplest Health Solutions? It’s Complicated
headline.main: The Simplest Health Solutions? It’s Complicated

docs.lead_paragraph: Why is something like a bar of soap, perhaps the greatest cheap medical fix of them all, just not good enough for us anymore?
docs.snippet: Why is something like a bar of soap, perhaps the greatest cheap medical fix of them all, just not good enough for us anymore?

headline.seo: Via Verde in South Bronx Rewrites Low-Income-Housing Rules
headline.print_headline: In a Bronx Complex, Doing Good Mixes With Looking Good
headline.main: In a Bronx Complex, Doing Good Mixes With Looking Good

docs.lead_paragraph: Via Verde, a subsidized housing development in the South Bronx, rethinks the mix of private and public spaces and makes an argument for the civic value of architecture.
docs.snippet: Via Verde, a subsidized housing development in the South Bronx, rethinks the mix of private and public spaces and makes an argument for the civic value of architecture.

headline.print_headline: A New Law on School Fitness Data Faces Obstacles
headline.main: A New Law on School Fitness Data Faces Obstacles

docs.lead_paragraph: A new law provides for deeper analysis of students’ physical fitness and its correlations, but the studies will involve fewer children.
docs.snippet: A new law provides for deeper analysis of students’ physical fitness and its correlations, but the studies will involve fewer children.
